subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Decline of Kelp Forests
description: Learn The Decline of Kelp Forests in one minute.

hook.text: Kelp forests are disappearing at a rate of 2% per year worldwide. Warming water is the main cause.

buildup.text: Kelp grows in cool, nutrient-rich water and provides shelter for hundreds of marine species.

discovery.text: As oceans warm, kelp struggles to grow. Marine heat waves can wipe out entire forests in weeks.

twist.text: Without kelp, sea urchins take over and create barren underwater deserts.

climax.text: Kelp forests absorb COâ‚‚ and protect coastlines from waves. Losing them accelerates both problems.

punchline.text: Underwater forests are falling. Most people never knew they existed.
